**Meeting Overview**:  
The Housing and Homelessness Solutions Committee of the Dallas City Council will hold a special called meeting on October 29, 2024, at 9:00 AM. The meeting will take place in the Council Chambers and will also be accessible via videoconference. The primary purpose is to discuss various housing finance initiatives and legislative impacts on local housing solutions.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
1. Approval of the minutes from the October 22, 2024 meeting.
2. Briefings on the Dallas Public Facility Corporation and Dallas Housing Finance Corporation.
3. Discussion of the Texas Department of Housing & Community Affairs (TDHCA) Mortgage Bond Program.
4. Overview of the 4% Low Income Housing Tax Credit (HTC) Program.
5. Updates from the Dallas Housing Finance Corporation.
6. Exploration of opportunities for Housing Finance Corporations.
7. Analysis of House Bill 2071 and its implications for Public Facilities Corporations (PFCs).
8. Recommendations for changes to the bylaws of the City of Dallas Local Government Corporations.

**Important Details**:  
The meeting will cover significant proposals related to housing finance, including updates on tax credit programs and legislative changes affecting local housing initiatives. Presentations will be provided by various experts, including representatives from TDHCA and legal counsel.

**Action Items**:  
The committee will seek approval of the meeting minutes and may consider recommendations for changes to local government corporation bylaws. Additionally, discussions may lead to decisions regarding the implementation of housing finance strategies and responses to legislative changes impacting the cityâ€™s housing policies.
